# Read student information and create a tuple

age = int(input())

# Create and print the tuple

print(student)

question_c672ca99-0355-444b-837f-4834e81.source_code:

point = (x, y)

question_388a2b21-bab3-44a0-bd02-907adee.source_code:
# Read the data
n = int(input())
numbers = tuple(map(int, input().split()))
target = int(input())

# Count occurrences
count = numbers.count(target)
print(count)

question_77bdcd12-700e-4215-bf19-2ff134f.source_code:
# Read number of students
n = int(input())

# Process each student record
students = []
for i in range(n):
    line = input().split()
    name = line[0]
    score = int(line[1])
    # Store as tuple
    students.append((name, score))

# Find student with highest score
highest_score = -1
best_student = ""
for student in students:
    name, score = student  # Tuple unpacking
    if score > highest_score:
        highest_score = score
        best_student = name

print(best_student)

question_7070bee5-088c-471c-af8b-9cbeb69.source_code:
# Read temperature data for 7 days
temperature_data = []
for i in range(7):
    line = input().split()
    day = line[0]
    temp = int(line[1])
    # Store as tuple
    temperature_data.append((day, temp))

# Analyze the data
highest_temp = temperature_data[0][1]
lowest_temp = temperature_data[0][1]
highest_day = temperature_data[0][0]
lowest_day = temperature_data[0][0]
total_temp = 0
days_above_20 = 0

for day, temp in temperature_data:
    # Track highest and lowest
    if temp > highest_temp:
        highest_temp = temp
        highest_day = day
    if temp < lowest_temp:
        lowest_temp = temp
        lowest_day = day
    
    # Sum for average
    total_temp += temp
    
    # Count days above 20
    if temp > 20:
        days_above_20 += 1

# Calculate average
average_temp = total_temp / 7

# Print results
print(highest_day)
print(lowest_day)
print(f"{average_temp:.1f}")
print(days_above_20)
